name: Berkeley Art Museum and Pacific Film Archive
summary: Cantilevered concrete slabs, classic brutalist massing with exposed raw surfaces.

name: UCLA Perloff Hall
summary: A functional and austere building designed for Architecture and Urban Design at UCLA. It features exposed concrete, and  a strong emphasis on rectilinear forms.

name: Geisel Library (UC San Diego)
summary: Iconic brutalist-futurist hybrid; spaceship-like with geometric concrete arms.

name: Salk Institute
summary: Minimalist and monumental modern architecture by Louis Kahn, with a symmetrical plaza and views of the Pacific.

name: College of the Canyons
summary: Clean concrete and stone structures with open courtyards and linear paths; minimalist modern campus design.

name: Los Angeles Union Station
summary: Streamline Moderne and Art Deco blend with Spanish Colonial Revival; ornate interiors and monumental form.

name: Eastern Columbia Building
summary: Turquoise terra cotta tower with copper details, one of LA's most iconic Art Deco landmarks.

name: San Diego Central Library
summary: Concrete civic building with steel dome and urban integration; a blend of brutalism and contemporary design.

name: Wurster Hall (UC Berkeley)
summary: Unapologetically brutal with raw, unpainted concrete and dense academic form.

name: Marin County Civic Center
summary: Designed by Frank Lloyd Wright; linear concrete structure with blue domes and arched corridors.

name: Griffith Observatory
summary: Iconic Los Angeles landmark with classical Art Deco elements and sweeping views of the city and stars.

name: Caltrans District 7 Headquarters
summary: Massive concrete and steel structure with futuristic lines and civic grandeur.

name: Millennium Biltmore Hotel
summary: Combines classical ornamentation with early Art Deco touches; a historical landmark in downtown LA.

name: Transamerica Pyramid
summary: Tall, futuristic pyramid-shaped skyscraper with angular lines and a glowing top beacon.

name: Getty Center
summary: White travertine and metal architecture on a hilltop; emphasizes light, clean lines, and modern minimalism.

name: Pacific Design Center (Blue Whale)
summary: Massive blue-glass and concrete building, sculptural and dominant on the skyline.

name: Bradbury Building
summary: Iconic skylit atrium with ornate ironwork; featured in many films for its surreal interior.

name: Los Angeles Times Building
summary: Streamlined exterior with vertical emphasis; a historic news and architecture landmark.

name: Oakland Museum of California
summary: Sunken terraces and massive concrete walls, blending brutalism with landscape architecture.

name: UC Irvine Humanities Hall
summary: Rectilinear design with rough concrete surfaces and tight pedestrian corridors.
